Package it.polimi.ingsw.view

Class Login

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.ingsw.view.Login
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ViewElement
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    LoginCLI, NewLoginGUI
    public abstract class Login
extends java.lang.Object
implements ViewElement
    Abstract class used to manage all the initial interactions with the user

    • Field Detail

      • socketEvent

        public final IEvent<Login,​java.lang.Boolean> socketEvent
        Event other classes can subscribe to. This event is used to notify the subscribers when the user chooses between Socket or RMI connection

      • nameEvent

        public final IEvent<Login,​java.lang.String> nameEvent
        Event other classes can subscribe to. This event is used to notify the subscribers when the user chooses their username

      • colorEvent

        public final IEvent<Login,​java.lang.Integer> colorEvent
        Event other classes can subscribe to. This event is used to notify the subscribers when the user chooses their player color

      • gameLengthEvent

        public final IEvent<Login,​java.lang.Integer> gameLengthEvent
        Event other classes can subscribe to. This event is used to notify the subscribers when the host chooses the number of skulls of which the game is going to be made of

      • gameMapEvent

        public final IEvent<Login,​java.lang.Integer> gameMapEvent
        Event other classes can subscribe to. This event is used to notify the subscribers when the host chooses the map type the game is going to be played in

      • rmiEvent

        public final IEvent<Login,​java.lang.Boolean> rmiEvent

      • loginCompletedEvent

        public final IEvent<Login,​MatchSnapshot> loginCompletedEvent
        Event other classes can subscribe to. This event is used to notify the subscribers when all the login tasks have been finished.

      • Login

        public Login()

    • Method Detail

      • askConnection

        public abstract void askConnection()
                            throws java.io.IOException
        Asks the user about which type of connection they want to use (RMI or Socket)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • notifyAccepted

        public abstract void notifyAccepted​(boolean accepted)
                             throws java.io.IOException
        This method is called in case the user's username has already been taken by someone else. It calls the askName method one more time if the accepted parameter is false.
        Parameters:
        accepted - Indicates whether the user's name of choice has been taken or not
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • timerStartedMessage

        public abstract void timerStartedMessage​(int time)
        Method that describes what to do when the server notifies the client about the start of the login timer. The exact protocol to follow depends on the interface chosen by the user
        Parameters:
        time - Amount of time left before the start of the match

      • notifyAvailableColor

        public abstract void notifyAvailableColor​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> availableColors)
                                   throws java.io.IOException
        Asks which color the user wants to take and sends the answer to the server via invoking the color Event.
        Parameters:
        availableColors - List of colors the player can choose since they've not been taken by other players in the room
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • timerTickMessage

        public abstract void timerTickMessage​(int time)
        Method that describes what to do when the server notifies the client about the amount of time left in the timer. The exact protocol to follow depends on the interface chosen by the user
        Parameters:
        time - Amount of time left before the start of the match

      • newPlayerMessage

        public abstract void newPlayerMessage​(java.lang.String name)
        Method that describes what to do when the server notifies the client about a new player joining the room. The exact protocol to follow depends on the interface chosen by the user
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the newly entered player

      • notifyHost

        public abstract void notifyHost​(boolean isHost)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        If the user is the host, then two questions are asked about how they want to set up the game. Then the server is notified of the user's answer via invoking gameLenghtevent and gameMapEvent
        Parameters:
        isHost - Indicates whether the user is the host (first one to enter the room) or not
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • login

        public abstract void login()
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Calls the default intro methods. They display the intro script and ask the player for a username
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • onModelChanged

        public void onModelChanged​(MatchSnapshot matchSnapshot)
        Description copied from interface: ViewElement
        Method that describes what to do when the server notifies the client about an update about the game state. The exact protocol to follow depends on the interface chosen by the user
        Specified by:
        onModelChanged in interface ViewElement
        Parameters:
        matchSnapshot - The new matchSnapshot that the scribe the new model state
